conclusion: Analyze the motion of the frame relative to the magnetic field and conditions for induced emf.
Magnetic field exists only within a certain region.
Induced emf is generated when a conducting loop moves through a magnetic field.
Magnetic flux through the loop must change for emf to be induced.
Frame is moving horizontally with velocity v; width of magnetic field is d, side length of frame is l.
Frame enters magnetic field when left edge crosses into the field.
Frame exits magnetic field when right edge crosses out of the field.
Calculate times at which frame enters and exits the magnetic field.
Left edge enters field completely when it has moved l/2 distance: t1 = l/(2v).
Right edge fully exits field when it has moved another l/2 distance: t2 = (d + l/2)/v.
Total time T during which there is an induced current: T = t2 - t1.
Final answer: Time during which there is an induced current is d/v.
